title: Appealing for verbose information when loading parameters with strict=False
body_html: I think the verbose information when using model.load_state_dict(params_dict, strict=False) is important, one can use it verify whether there is something wrong at loading parameters procedure. I found that in the current version of pytorch, there isn't enough information printed when strict=False. Is it possible to add it in the near future release version?
body_text: I think the verbose information when using model.load_state_dict(params_dict, strict=False) is important, one can use it verify whether there is something wrong at loading parameters procedure. I found that in the current version of pytorch, there isn't enough information printed when strict=False. Is it possible to add it in the near future release version?
body: I think the verbose information when using `model.load_state_dict(params_dict, strict=False)` is important, one can use it verify whether there is something wrong at loading parameters procedure. I found that in the current version of pytorch, there isn't enough information printed when `strict=False`. Is it possible to add it in the near future release version?
